result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Stephanie Ann Husom.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The department is currently seeking revocation on a Wakashaw case. Hearing is scheduled for November 30th on the revocation. ADA Kohl does not want to present an offer until the revocation is resolved. Matter set over to allow revocation hearing to take place first.
Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:25 AM Defendant Stephanie Ann Husom appeared by video.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Stephanie Ann Husom.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense is not ready to proceed with plea and sentencing today. Defendant waives her right to personal appearance for the plea and sentencing hearing. The Court requests Attorney Fitzgerald have his client fill out the waiver of personal appearance paperwork and sign. The Court also requests the plea questionnaire to be filled out and signed prior to the plea and sentencing hearing. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

WCCC sent to GCSD and Monroe PD

1:27 PM Defendant Stephanie Ann Husom appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith appeared by video on behalf of Attorney James Fitzgerald not in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Krueger Smith requests matter be set over for a plea. The Court quashes warrant and reinstated previous bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:14 PM The Court recalls this case. Defendant Stephanie Ann Husom in court via phone.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Stephanie Ann Husom. Parties do not have a resolution on this case at this time. Tracking along with 21CF64. Matter set over. The Court vacates the issue of a warrant. Status conference scheduled September 7, 2022 at 3:15 PM.

2:30 PM Defendant Stephanie Ann Husom not in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Stephanie Ann Husom. 
 Attorney Fitzgerald states there is no resolution in this case. Based on the defendants non appearance the State requests a bench warrant be issued. The Court directs a bench warrant to issue. Body Only, nationwide. The Court stays the warrant until 4:30 PM 7/20/2022.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:07 AM Defendant Stephanie Ann Husom not in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald not in court. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Stephanie Ann Husom, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel C. James Fitzgerald. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Preliminary Hearing questionare and waiver gone over on the record with the Defendant as well as via phone with her Attorney prior to today's hearing. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing. The court accepts the waiver.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.   Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties.   Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond continues. Matter set over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
